title: How Many Calories Are in a PB&J Sandwich?
meta_description: Learn how many calories are in pb and j sandwich—a standard one has about 390 kcal—plus full macros, per-sandwich nutrition, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in a PB&J Sandwich?
assumptions: Standard PB&J: 2 slices white bread (28g each), 2 tbsp creamy peanut butter (32g), 1 tbsp grape jelly (20g); no added ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, PB brand, jelly flavor/amount, and preparation; check labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A standard PB&J sandwich contains about 390 calories, with 13g protein and 50g carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white
Natural peanut butter (no added sugar/oil, 2 tbsp)

faqs.q: How many calories are in pb and j sandwich?
faqs.a: About 390 kcal for a standard PB&J with 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp PB, and 1 tbsp jelly.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a PB&J?
faqs.a: Roughly 13g, mostly from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: Does PB&J have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, about 15g total, mainly from jelly and bread.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in pb and j?
faqs.a: Opt for thinner spreads, whole grain bread, or low-sugar jelly to cut 20-50 kcal.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in a peanut butter and jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 50g carbs per sandwich, from bread and jelly; fiber is about 3g.
